techmeme.title: The UK's ICO says it's probing how TikTok uses 13-17-year-olds' personal data for content suggestions and how Reddit and Imgur verify the ages of child users (Reuters)
A look at ALERTCalifornia, a program from UC San Diego, which has deployed over 1,150 AI-equipped cameras to monitor wildfires and other natural disasters (Jim Carlton/Wall Street Journal)
The US' plan to cut federal contracts imperils Booz Allen Hamilton, which gets most of its revenue from providing IT and AI services across the government (Chip Cutter/Wall Street Journal)
A trader used $6M to open a 50x leveraged long position on both BTC and ETH before Trump's crypto reserve announcement and closed their position for a $7M gain (Zack Abrams/The Block)
CrowdStrike: in 2024, 79% of cyber intrusions were malware-free, up from 40% in 2019, voice phishing overtook phishing as the main first access method, and more (Duncan Riley/SiliconANGLE)
